| Overview                = The '''Man-Apes''' were [[Neanderthals]]{{r|Marvel Atlas #2|; [[Savage Land]]'s entry, Nonhuman population's section}} (or Neanderthal-like creatures) living in the [[Savage Land]].{{r|Marvel Pets Handbook #1|; [[Zabu (Earth-616)|Zabu]]'s entry}}
| History                 = 
[[Maa-Gor (Earth-616)|Maa-Gor]]'s tribe were said to have been the last living Man-Apes in the [[Savage Land]].{{r|X-Men #10}}

[[Kevin Plunder (Earth-616)|Ka-Zar]] killed the last male Man-Apes of this tribe except Maa-Gor himself. When Maa-Gor was transformed into the Man-God, he resurrected his tribe, but they disappeared after he lost his powers.{{r|Ka-Zar Vol 2 #4|5}}

A bunch of Neanderthals were shown living on an island in the Savage Land's inland sea. They ended up in a fight with [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Wolverine]] (who was trying to save the S.H.I.E.L.D. Agent that they captured) until [[Shanna O'Hara (Earth-616)|Shanna the She-Devil]] arrives.{{r|Savage Wolverine #1}} While setting out to destroy the Cthulhu-type machine, Wolverine and Shanna the She-Devil encounter heavy Neanderthal resistance.{{r|Savage Wolverine #2}} During the fight against the Neanderthals, Shanna was killed by one of them, leaving Wolverine alone. Luckily for Wolverine, [[Amadeus Cho (Earth-616)|Amadeus Cho]] was also on the island and convinced the Neanderthals that he was their god and to help Shanna{{r|Savage Wolverine #3}} by using the life blood of a [[Man-Things|Man-Thing]] native to the Savage Land to resurrect her.{{r|Savage Wolverine #4}}
